intro: Dufourea glabra, commonly known as the smooth dufourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in a range of soil types. Dufourea glabra is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insects.
